title.narrative: Influencing Global Level Protection Policy and Practice

description.narrative: The humanitarian community has come under increased pressure to enhance the overall strategic character of protection in humanitarian response and to demonstrate measurable results for enhanced protection in terms of reduced risk of violence, coercion and deprivation experienced by conflict affected populations. This means a more robust evidence base and more clearly articulated strategy involving the roles of different actors to bring about protection outcomes. This action, implemented by International Rescue Committee (IRC) in partnership with InterAction (IA), proposes to address these issues through a comprehensive and collaborative systems-level strategy to establish a new standard of protection programming and policy. InterActionÆs programme entails elaborating the key elements of results-based protection in practice, building up a documented body of good practice, and promoting the adoption of key elements for a results-based approach by humanitarian actors. The programme will also examine the relationship of humanitarian actors with UN political and peacekeeping missions in order to generate policy options to support the realization of protection outcomes in practice. The programme will be implemented through NGO-initiated and led collaboration and coordination, including through a Results-Based Protection Learning and Steering Group, the Global Protection Cluster, and the Inter-Agency Standing Committee (IASC).
